questions.question: In case you …………………………… John, tell him that he still owes me a drink.
You never say what you are thinking, ……………………………….?
questions.description: Non-negative tags are used after words like never, no, nobody etc.

questions.question: I ………………………………. beach holidays.
questions.description: In the simple present tense, questions and negatives are made with do.

questions.question: Did you …………………………….. swimming yesterday?
questions.description: After do, does and did, we use the infinitive without to.

questions.question: We need to know ……………………………… he is coming tomorrow.
questions.description: Whether is a question word used in indirect questions.

questions.question: I promise I …………………………….. any more.
questions.description: We do not normally use the simple present to talk about the future.

questions.question: I …………………………… my new job tomorrow.
questions.description: The simple present is used to refer to future events which are timetabled.

questions.question: I wasn’t …………………………… that she was there.
questions.description: Prepositions are not used before that.

questions.question: The virus ……………………………….. thousands of people across the world.
questions.description: The present perfect is used to give news.

questions.question: The portrait …………………………….. by a famous artist.
Aren’t you interested ……………………………… what happened to him?
questions.description: Interested can be followed by an -ing form or infinitive. This is common when we are talking about a wish to find out something.
